items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message:
Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 09 November 2025 . 
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message as the situation changes. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 10 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea,  over the next two days may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible today, Sunday 9th November, and throughout the weekend.

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  The Broads and river levels will remain high over the next couple of days due to tide locking from the current spring tides.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Monday 10 November 2025. or as the situation changes.

Flooding is possible today, Sunday 9th November, and throughout the weekend.

items.description: River Cole, Dorcan Brook and South Marston Brook
items.message:
Forecast rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from overnight on 09 November 2025 . 
Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible, especially in the Lower Stratton and Kestrel Drive areas. We expect river levels to begin rising overnight on 09/11/25 and to peak before falling again tomorrow morning.  Further rainfall is forecast over the coming days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 09:00 10 Nov 2025 or as the situation changes. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 6:17PM on 09 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
The previous tide of concern has now passed,  the weather is more settled and no flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
The weather forecast for Sunday is light showers throughout the day, clearing by Monday morning.

River levels and lakes such as Derwent Water are falling and will continue to do so throughout the day.

We continue to monitor the situation. Do not walk or drive through flood water.

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 10th November 2025.
